messages.content:
The ending of *Sakamichi no Apollon* (Kids on the Slope) focuses on the characters moving forward while maintaining music as a central part of their lives [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [pixnet](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1). The friends, who had previously drifted apart, ultimately reunite through their shared passion for music, resolving past conflicts [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [pixnet](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1).

However, there are some key differences between the anime and manga endings [douban](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2). In the anime, the ending depicts the main characters reuniting through music, suggesting a resolution [douban](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2). In contrast, the manga shows Kaoru meeting Sentaro at a church, but they don't play music at that time, and Ritsuko is not present [douban](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2). Furthermore, Yurika does not become pregnant in the manga [gamer](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3). Ritsuko also has a proper farewell with Kaoru in the manga, giving him a gift, unlike the anime [gamer](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3).

After going to Tokyo University in the manga, Kaoru avoids jazz until his mother sings "Lullaby of Birdland" [gamer](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3). He then joins a jazz club, gets a part-time job, and finds a photo of himself and Sentaro in Ritsuko's farewell gift, prompting him to find Sentaro [gamer](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3). Kaoru and Ritsuko exchange letters, but they eventually become less frequent because a man told Kaoru to stop contacting her [gamer](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3). They later reunite at Sachiko's wedding, where Ritsuko clarifies that the man acted on his own and that she is still single [gamer](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3). Ultimately, Kaoru decides to stay on the island with Sentaro, giving up the opportunity to inherit his family's hospital and bringing his damaged "Moanin'" record with him [gamer](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3).

Throughout the series, friendship, particularly the bond between Kaoru and Sentaro, is a central theme, strengthened by their shared love for jazz music [pixnet](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4) [kzeng](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5). Music serves as a unifying force, facilitating interactions and personal growth, helping the characters overcome challenges and express their emotions [pixnet](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0). The 1960s setting adds depth to the characters' relationships and the challenges they face [pixnet](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4) [pixnet](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) [douban](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6). The series also explores complex romantic relationships, intertwined with themes of friendship and personal growth [pixnet](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4) [pixnet](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1).

search_query: 坂道上的阿波罗 ending explained
web_research_result:
Based on the search results, here's an explanation of the ending of *坂道上的阿波罗 (Sakamichi no Apollon)*, also known as *Kids on the Slope*:

**General Ending Summary:**

The ending of *Sakamichi no Apollon* sees the characters moving forward in their lives, with music remaining a central theme. The friends, [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [pixnet](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) who had drifted apart, reunite through music, resolving past conflicts.

**Differenc [douban](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2)es Between Anime and Manga Endings:**

*   **Reunion:** In the anime, the ending shows the main characters reuniting through music, suggesting a resolution and a return to their shared passion. The manga ha [douban](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2)s a slightly different approach. In the manga, Kaoru (薰) meets Sentaro (千太郎) at a church, but Sentaro doesn't have time to play the drums then. They don't meet Ritsuko (律子) on the slope in the manga.
*   **Yurika (百合香):** Yu [gamer](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3)rika does not become pregnant in the manga.
*   **Ritsuko's Farewell:** In [gamer](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3) the manga, Ritsuko manages to say goodbye to Kaoru and personally gives him a farewell gift. This differs from the anime where they bid farewell from a distance.
*   **Kaoru's Feelings:** Afte [gamer](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3)r going to Tokyo University, Kaoru avoids jazz until his mother starts singing "Lullaby of Birdland." He then joins a jazz club and gets a part-time job. He finds a photo of himself and Sentaro in Ritsuko's farewell gift, which prompts him to find Sentaro.
*   **Ritsuko's Relationship:* [gamer](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3)* Ritsuko and Kaoru continue to exchange letters, but eventually, the letters become less frequent. Kaoru discovers that Ritsuko has stopped writing to him because a man who was visiting her told him not to contact her anymore. Later, Kaoru and Ritsuko reunite at Sachiko's wedding, where Ritsuko clarifies that the man acted on his own and that she is still single.
*   **Kaoru's Decision:** Kaor [gamer](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3)u decides to stay on the island with Sentaro, giving up the opportunity to inherit his family's hospital. He brings his damaged "Moanin'" record with him.

**Key Themes and Interpretati [gamer](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3)ons:**

*   **Friendship:** The series emphasizes the importance of friendship, particularly between Kaoru and Sentaro. Their bond is strengthened thr [pixnet](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4) [kzeng](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5)ough their shared love of jazz music.
*   **Music as a Unifying Forc [pixnet](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4)e:** Jazz serves as a catalyst for the characters' interactions and personal growth. It helps them overcome challen [pixnet](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0)ges and express their emotions.

The setting adds depth to the  [pixnet](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4) [pixnet](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) [douban](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6)characters' relationships and the challenges they face.
